Class SimpleJdbcMapper

java.lang.Object
io.github.simplejdbcmapper.core.SimpleJdbcMapper
public final class SimpleJdbcMapper extends Object
CRUD methods and configuration for SimpleJdbcMapper. Should be prepared in a Spring application context and given to services as bean reference. SimpleJdbcMapper caches Table meta-data and SQL. Note: An instance of SimpleJdbcMapper is thread safe once instantiated. 




Author:


ajoseph

    • 

      

      insert
      

      

      public void insert(Object obj)
      

      Inserts an object. Objects with auto increment id will have the id set to the
new id from database. For non auto increment id the id has to be manually set
before invoking insert().


      Will handle the following annotations:
@CreatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
@CreatedBy if RecordOperatorResolver is configured with SimpleJdbcMapper the property 
     will be assigned that value
@UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
@UpdatedBy if RecordOperatorResolver is configured with SimpleJdbcMapper the property
               will be assigned that value
@Version property will be set to 1. Used for optimistic locking.

      

      

      Parameters:
      

      obj - The object to be saved
      

      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      update
      

      

      public Integer update(Object obj)
      

      Update the object.


      Will handle the following annotations:
@UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
@UpdatedBy if RecordOperatorResolver is configured with SimpleJdbcMapper the property 
               will be assigned that value
@Version property will be incremented on a successful update. An OptimisticLockingException
               will be thrown if object is stale.

      

      

      Parameters:
      

      obj - object to be updated
      

      Returns:
      

      number of records updated
      

      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      updateSpecificProperties
      

      

      public Integer updateSpecificProperties(Object obj,
 String... propertyNames)
      

      Updates the specified properties passed in as arguments. Use it to update a
property or a few properties of the object and not the whole object. Issues
an SQL update statement for only for the specific properties and any auto assign
properties.


      Will handle the following annotations:
@UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
@UpdatedBy if RecordOperatorResolver is configured with SimpleJdbcMapper the property 
               will be assigned that value
@Version property will be incremented on a successful update. An OptimisticLockingException
               will be thrown if object is stale.

      

      

      Parameters:
      

      obj - object to be updated
      

      propertyNames - the specific property names that need to be updated.
      

      Returns:
      

      number of records updated
      

      

      

      

      • 

    •

      getBeanFriendlySqlColumns
      

      

      public String getBeanFriendlySqlColumns(Class<?> clazz)
      

      Gets the sql for the columns. Works well with Spring row mappers like
BeanPropertyRowMapper(), SimplePropertyRowMapper() etc. Will create the
needed column aliases when the column name does not match the corresponding
underscore case property name.


      
Will return something like below if 'name' property is mapped to 'last_name'
column in database:


      "id as id, last_name AS name"

      

      

      Parameters:
      

      clazz - the class
      

      Returns:
      

      comma separated select column string
      

      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      getPropertyToColumnMappings
      

      

      public Map<String,String> getPropertyToColumnMappings(Class<?> clazz)
      

      returns a map with all the properties of the class with their corresponding
column names
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      clazz - the class
      

      Returns:
      

      map of property and their corresponding columns
      

      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      loadMapping
      

      

      public void loadMapping(Class<?> clazz)
      

      Loads the mapping for a class. Model mappings are loaded when they are used
for the first time. This method is provided so that the mappings can be
loaded during Spring application startup if needed.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      clazz - the class
